title: Friday night (high)lights
text:
Last Slide Next Slide 
QUOTEWORTHY 
“It’s good to win like that. It’s great to win where your defense creates points for you. I wish we’d been doing that all year. We need to do that next week for sure (when La Vergne plays undefeated Independence). We came out ready to play again tonight. When we play with that kind of intensity, good things happen.” – La Vergne coach Stanton Stevens, whose defense had two fumble returns for a TD and an interception return that ultimately ended in a TD. Read more 
“The coaches had a good game plan and the line did a great job blocking. Coach told us to make our mark and write our own book and we did that.” – Blackman running back Taeler Dowdy, who had four total TDs in a 42-20 win over Coffee County. Read more 
“I think we’ve gotten tremendously better. We’re coming together more as a team. The main difference in us now and a month ago is people are starting to trust the other guys to do their job. Trust makes a difference.” – Westmoreland QB Bayle, who completed three passes for 167 yards and two TDs and also rushed for 45 yards in a blowout win over Cascade. Read more 
“They run a tough offense. They have a triple option and it’s assignment football…and it’s hard to defend, but when they have athletes it makes it double hard.” – Dickson county coach Troy Williams, on Clarksville High’s offense. The Cougars topped the Wildcats 29-26. Read more 
"On Monday through Thursday, we're a different Smyrna this year. We're going to make plays. Oakland better be ready." – Smyrna quarterback John Turner, whose squad topped Riverdale 21-14. The Bulldogs, tied for second place in 3-6A, play Oakland in the regular-season finale. Read more 
"Just when you think you've seen it all in this game, a night like this will come along. The ball bounced some crazy ways tonight. My hat's off to both teams on a great football game." – Marshall County coach Thomas Olsteen, whose squad escaped Maplewood with a 34-33, double-OT victory.
